passage.title: Composed upon Westminster Bridge, September 3, 1802
passage.author: William Wordsworth
passage.content:
Earth has not anything to show more fair:
Dull would he be of soul who could pass by
A sight so touching in its majesty:
This City now doth, like a garment, wear
The beauty of the morning; silent, bare,
Ships, towers, domes, theatres, and temples lie
Open unto the fields, and to the sky;
All bright and glittering in the smokeless air.
Never did sun more beautifully steep
In his first splendour, valley, rock, or hill;
Ne'er saw I, never felt, a calm so deep!
The river glideth at his own sweet will:
Dear God! the very houses seem asleep;
And all that mighty heart is lying still!

subSections.title: Write ‘TRUE’ for true and ‘FALSE’ for the false statements.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The speaker believes there is no sight on Earth more beautiful than the one from Westminster Bridge.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको पहिलो पङ्क्ति, "Earth has not anything to show more fair," ले स्पष्ट पार्छ कि वक्ताले यो दृश्यलाई पृथ्वीमा सबैभन्दा सुन्दर मान्छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first line of the poem, "Earth has not anything to show more fair," makes it clear that the speaker considers this sight the most beautiful on Earth. Citations: chapter 12, page 199.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The city is described as noisy and crowded in the morning.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले शहरलाई "silent, bare" भनेर वर्णन गरेको छ र घरहरू "asleep" देखिन्छन्, जसले शान्त र खाली वातावरणलाई संकेत गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem describes the city as "silent, bare" and says the houses seem "asleep," which indicates a quiet and empty atmosphere. Citations: chapter 12, page 199.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The air in the city is described as being polluted with smoke.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले शहर "All bright and glittering in the smokeless air" अर्थात् धुवाँरहित हावामा चम्किरहेको उल्लेख गरेको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem mentions the city is "All bright and glittering in the smokeless air." Citations: chapter 12, page 199.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The river is flowing aggressively and rapidly.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कवितामा भनिएको छ, "The river glideth at his own sweet will," जसले नदी शान्त र सहज रूपमा बगिरहेको देखाउँछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem states, "The river glideth at his own sweet will," which suggests the river is flowing calmly and gently. Citations: chapter 12, page 199.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The speaker feels a deep sense of calm while observing the city.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: वक्ताले आफ्नो भावना व्यक्त गर्छन्, "Ne'er saw I, never felt, a calm so deep!" जसले उनको गहिरो शान्तिको अनुभवलाई देखाउँछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The speaker expresses his feeling, "Ne'er saw I, never felt, a calm so deep!" which shows his experience of profound calmness. Citations: chapter 12, page 199.

passage.title: Wisdom of Little Girls
passage.content:
Two little girls from different houses happened to meet in a lane. The dirty water after running through the farm-yards had formed a large puddle. One girl was very small, the other a little bigger. Their mothers had dressed them both in new frocks.

Soon the fancy took them to splash about in the water, and the smaller one was going to step into the puddle, shoes and all, when the elder checked her: 'Don't go in so, Malasha,' said she, 'your mother will scold you. I will take off my shoes and stockings, and you take off yours.'

They did so; and then, picking up their skirts, began walking towards each other through the puddle. When they got near one another, Akoulya said: 'Mind, Malasha, don't splash. Walk carefully!' She had hardly said this, when Malasha plumped down her foot so that the water splashed right on to Akoulya's frock. The frock was splashed, and so were Akoulya's eyes and nose. When she saw the stains on her frock, she was angry and ran after Malasha to strike her.

Just then Akoulya's mother happened to be passing, and seeing her daughter's skirt was splashed, she seized Malasha, and struck her. Malasha began to howl. Her mother came out and began scolding her neighbour. One word led to another and they had an angry quarrel. The men came out, and a crowd collected, everyone shouting. They all went on quarreling, till Akoulya's old grandmother tried to calm them. But they would not listen. While the women were abusing each other, Akoulya had wiped the mud off her frock, and gone back to the puddle. She took a stone and began scraping away the earth to make a channel. Presently Malasha joined her, and with a chip of wood helped her dig the channel. The little girls ran straight into the group of men. The old woman, seeing them, said to the men: 'Are you not ashamed of yourselves? To go fighting on account of these lassies, when they themselves have forgotten all about it, and are playing happily together. Dear little souls! They are wiser than you!'

subQuestions.correctAnswer: The quarrel started when Akoulya's mother struck Malasha, and Malasha's mother came out and started scolding her.

subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The quarrel began when Akoulya's mother struck Malasha, which led to Malasha's mother coming out and scolding the neighbour. Citations: chapter 11, page 173.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What did Akoulya and Malasha do while the adults were fighting?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They went back to the puddle and worked together to dig a channel for the water to flow out.

subQuestions.explanationEnglish: While the adults were fighting, the two girls started working together to dig a channel for the water. Citations: chapter 11, page 173.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How did the adults' quarrel finally end?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It ended when they saw the two little girls playing happily together, making them feel ashamed of their own fighting.

subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When the men saw the girls playing happily together, they felt ashamed and went back to their homes. Citations: chapter 11, page 174.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the main message of the story?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The main message is that children are often wiser and more forgiving than adults, and we should learn to let go of anger and resolve conflicts peacefully.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कथाको मुख्य सन्देश यो हो कि बालबालिकाहरू प्रायः ठूलाहरूभन्दा बढी बुद्धिमान र क्षमाशील हुन्छन्, र हामीले रिसलाई त्यागेर शान्तिपूर्वक विवाद समाधान गर्न सिक्नुपर्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The story's main message is that children are often wiser and more forgiving than adults, and we should learn to let go of anger and resolve conflicts peacefully. Citations: chapter 11, pages 172-174.

passage.content:
Sunshine Secondary School
Sports Club
Date: 5th October, 2025

This is to inform all students that the annual 'Sports Week' will be held from 15th to 20th October, 2025. A variety of track and field events, as well as team sports, will be organized.

Events include:
- 100m, 200m, and 400m races
- Long Jump and High Jump
- Shot Put
- Football (Boys)
- Volleyball (Girls)
- Basketball (Boys & Girls)

Interested students are requested to register their names for their desired events with their respective House Captains by 10th October, 2025. A student can participate in a maximum of three individual events and one team sport. All events will take place at the school playground, starting at 9:00 AM each day.

All students are encouraged to participate enthusiastically to make this event a grand success.

(Signature)
Sports In-charge

passage.title: Flowers in Russian Culture
passage.content:
Flowers are a staple item in the gift-giving world. Flower etiquette, in Russia, is strictly guided by a range of rules depending on the setting. If flowers are gifted outside these rules, it is possible to offend the receiver.

Red carnations are filled with a deep sense of patriotism, originating from the 1917 February Revolution. In contrast, white carnations represent bad omens and are believed to strip holders of good luck and talent.

In Russian culture, yellow flowers symbolise sadness and dishonesty. Therefore, giving a bunch of yellow flowers to a beloved one represents an inevitable break-up. This is famously represented in the break-up song called 'yellow tulips.'

Chamomile is the national flower of Russia. Its slender white petals encapsulate a bright yellow centre. Russians believe that chamomile, in the form of tea and aromatherapy, offers a vast range of medical benefits. A lesser-known belief suggests that the chamomile is a mosquito and fly repellent. Among women, chamomile holds a fortune-telling function. The self-murmured pattern of 'he loves me, he loves me not' is repeated until the last petal is plucked.

The white calla lily is an elegant flower. However, bringing a white lily bouquet to a Russian wedding would not be a good idea. These flowers symbolise death and are believed to foreshadow the split of the newly-wed couple.

questions.title: Imagine you have lost your English textbook in the school. Write a 'Lost and Found' notice to be put on the school notice board.

sampleAnswer.title: LOST! LOST! LOST!
sampleAnswer.content:
I have lost my Grade 10 English Textbook somewhere in the school premises, most likely in the library or on the playground, yesterday (15th September, Friday) during the lunch break.

The book has a blue plastic cover and my name, 'Anjali Sharma, Class 10-B', is written on the first page. It is very important for my studies.

Anyone who finds it is kindly requested to return it to the undersigned or deposit it at the school's reception. A suitable reward is promised.

questions.title: Your friend was absent from school because he/she was sick. Write a message of sympathy in about 100 words.
clues: mention you miss them in school

sampleAnswer.title: Message of Sympathy
sampleAnswer.content:
Dear Rohan,

I was so sad to hear that you have been sick with a fever and couldn't come to school. I was really worried about you. I hope you are feeling much better now and are on your way to a full recovery.

We all miss you in class, especially during the maths period! Don't worry about the missed lessons; I have taken notes for you and will help you catch up when you are back. Please take good care of yourself and get plenty of rest. I wish you a very speedy recovery and hope to see you back at school soon.

Get well soon!

Your friend,
Aayush
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले बिरामी साथीलाई पठाइने सहानुभूति सन्देश हो। यसले बिरामी भएकोमा दुःख व्यक्त गर्दछ, स्वास्थ्यको बारेमा सोधपुछ गर्दछ, छुटेको पाठमा मद्दत गर्ने प्रस्ताव गर्दछ, र शीघ्र स्वास्थ्य लाभको कामना गर्दछ। सन्देशको टोन हेरचाह र सहयोगी छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer is a sympathy message to a sick friend. It expresses sadness about the illness, inquires about their health, offers help with missed lessons, and wishes for a speedy recovery. The tone is caring and supportive. Citations: chapter 11, page 187.

questions.title: Write a couple of paragraphs expressing your views on 'The Importance of Games and Sports in a Student's Life' in about 150 words.

sampleAnswer.content:
Games and sports are an indispensable part of a student's life. While academic education is crucial for intellectual development, sports are essential for physical fitness and mental well-being. Engaging in sports helps students build strong muscles and bones, improve cardiovascular health, and maintain a healthy weight. This physical activity provides a much-needed break from the sedentary routine of classroom learning, refreshing the mind and improving concentration. Therefore, schools should treat sports not as a mere extracurricular activity but as a vital component of the curriculum.

Furthermore, the benefits of sports extend beyond physical health. They instill valuable life skills such as teamwork, discipline, leadership, and resilience. When students play as part of a team, they learn to cooperate and communicate with others to achieve a common goal. They also learn to handle both victory and defeat gracefully, which is a crucial lesson for life. Participating in sports builds confidence and sportsmanship, shaping students into well-rounded individuals who are prepared to face the challenges of the world.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले विद्यार्थी जीवनमा खेलकुदको महत्त्वबारे दुई अनुच्छेदमा विचार प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। पहिलो अनुच्छेदले शारीरिक र मानसिक स्वास्थ्यमा हुने फाइदाहरूमा केन्द्रित छ। दोस्रो अनुच्छेदले टिमवर्क, अनुशासन र लचिलोपन जस्ता जीवन कौशलहरूको विकासमा खेलकुदको भूमिकाबारे छलफल गर्दछ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents views on the importance of sports in a student's life in two paragraphs. The first paragraph focuses on the benefits for physical and mental health. The second paragraph discusses the role of sports in developing life skills like teamwork, discipline, and resilience. Citations: chapter 10, page 160.

questions.title: Write a short biography of a historical figure from Nepal (e.g., Amar Singh Thapa, Bhrikuti, Arniko) in about 200 words.

sampleAnswer.title: Arniko: The Great Nepali Architect
sampleAnswer.content:
Arniko was a brilliant Nepali architect and artist who lived in the 13th century. He is celebrated for his exceptional skills that took Nepali art and architecture to the international stage, particularly to Tibet and China. At a young age, Arniko mastered the arts of painting, sculpture, and architecture. His talent was so profound that he was chosen to lead a delegation of eighty artisans to Tibet to construct a golden stupa.

His work in Tibet was so impressive that he was invited by the Mongol emperor Kublai Khan to his court in China. In China, Arniko designed and built numerous magnificent structures, including the famous White Stupa at the Miaoying Temple in Beijing, which still stands today as a testament to his genius. He also excelled in painting and sculpture, creating beautiful portraits and statues. Arniko was not just an artist; he was also a cultural ambassador who created a strong bond between Nepal, Tibet, and China through art.

He is remembered for his incredible artistic talent, leadership, and his role in spreading Nepali artistic traditions across Asia. His legacy continues to inspire artists and architects today.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले १३औं शताब्दीका नेपाली वास्तुकार अरनिकोको जीवनी प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले उनको तिब्बत र चीनमा गरेका मुख्य उपलब्धिहरू, जस्तै बेइजिङको सेतो स्तूप, र नेपाली कला फैलाउनमा उनको भूमिकालाई हाइलाइट गर्दछ। जीवनीले उनको कलात्मक प्रतिभा र सांस्कृतिक राजदूतको रूपमा उनको विरासतलाई जोड दिन्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer provides a biography of the 13th-century Nepali architect, Arniko. It highlights his major achievements in Tibet and China, such as the White Stupa in Beijing, and his role in spreading Nepali art. The biography emphasizes his artistic genius and his legacy as a cultural ambassador. Citations: chapter 15, page 248.

questions.title: Reproduce the following sentences as instructed in the brackets.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Nothing is impossible, __________? (Add a correct question tag.)
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'Nothing' एक नकारात्मक शब्द हो, त्यसैले प्रश्न ट्याग सकारात्मक हुनुपर्छ। 'Nothing' को लागि सर्वनाम 'it' प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: 'Nothing' is a negative word, so the question tag must be positive. The pronoun for 'Nothing' is 'it'. Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: I had my car repaired. (Change into active voice with an agent.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: I had a mechanic repair my car.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: Causative verb 'have' को active voice संरचना 'have + agent (person) + bare infinitive (v1)' हुन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The active voice structure with the causative verb 'have' is 'have + agent (person) + bare infinitive (v1)'. Citations: chapter 18, page 307.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He said, "I will do it tomorrow." (Change into indirect speech.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He said that he would do it the next day.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: अप्रत्यक्ष बोलीमा, 'will' लाई 'would' मा र 'tomorrow' लाई 'the next day' मा परिवर्तन गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: In indirect speech, 'will' changes to 'would' and 'tomorrow' changes to 'the next day'. Citations: chapter 1, page 14.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: She is used to ________ (wake) up early. (Use the correct form of the verb 'wake' to complete the sentence.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: She is used to waking up early.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: वाक्यांश 'be used to' पछि क्रियाको gerund form (v-ing) को प्रयोग हुन्छ, जसले बानीलाई जनाउँछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The phrase 'be used to' is followed by the gerund form (v-ing) of the verb to indicate a habit. Citations: chapter 9, page 140.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He is so weak that he cannot walk. (Rewrite using 'too...to'.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He is too weak to walk.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'so...that...cannot' लाई 'too...to' को संरचना प्रयोग गरेर प्रतिस्थापन गर्न सकिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: 'so...that...cannot' can be replaced by the structure 'too...to'. Citations: chapter 11, page 185.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Who broke this glass? (Change into passive voice.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: By whom was this glass broken?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'Who' बाट सुरु हुने प्रश्नलाई passive voice मा परिवर्तन गर्दा, यो 'By whom' बाट सुरु हुन्छ र प्रश्नवाचक संरचना कायम रहन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When changing a question starting with 'Who' to the passive voice, it begins with 'By whom' and the interrogative structure is maintained. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

questions.title: Choose and copy the correct answers from the brackets to complete the given text. (Rewriting the text is not compulsory.)
questions.passage: My sister works (a) _____ (in/at/on/for) a hospital. She is (b) _____ (a/an/the/no article) nurse. Yesterday, she came home very late. She (c) _____ (looked/was looking/had looked/has looked) very tired. I asked her, "Why are you so late?" She said that she (d) _____ (has to/had to/must/should) look after a serious patient. The patient (e) _____ (was brought/brought/had brought/was being brought) to the hospital in the morning. (f) _____ (In spite of/Although/Because/Therefore) her tiredness, she cooked dinner for us. She is very good at cooking, (g) _____ (is she/isn't she/does she/doesn't she)? If she had not been a nurse, she (h) _____ (will be/would be/would have been/had been) a great chef. She often gets her colleagues (i) _____ (to taste/taste/tasted/tasting) her new recipes. She is (j) _____ (loved/is loving/loves/was loved) by everyone in her office.

gaps.explanationNepali: अस्पताल जस्ता भवन भित्र काम गर्ने ठाउँ जनाउन 'in' preposition को प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The preposition 'in' is used for a place of work inside a building, like a hospital. Citations: chapter 15, page 259.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'nurse' एक singular countable noun हो र यो consonant ध्वनि /n/ बाट सुरु हुन्छ, त्यसैले 'a' article को प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'nurse' is a singular countable noun beginning with a consonant sound /n/, so the article 'a' is used. Citations: chapter 7, page 120.

gaps.explanationNepali: कथा भूतकालमा भएको घटनाको वर्णन गरिरहेको छ, त्यसैले simple past tense 'looked' उपयुक्त छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The story is narrating a past event, so the simple past tense 'looked' is appropriate. Citations: chapter 9, page 147.

gaps.explanationNepali: अप्रत्यक्ष बोलीमा, simple past (said) पछि, 'have to' लाई 'had to' मा परिवर्तन गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In indirect speech, following the simple past (said), 'have to' is changed to 'had to'. Citations: chapter 11, page 183.

gaps.explanationNepali: दुईवटा भूतकालका कार्यहरू मध्ये, पहिले भएको कार्य (बिरामी ल्याइएको) को लागि past perfect passive ('had been brought') को प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: When there are two past actions, the past perfect passive ('had been brought') is used for the action that happened earlier (the patient was brought). Citations: chapter 9, page 147.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'In spite of' पछि एक संज्ञा वाक्यांश ('her tiredness') आउँछ र यसले विरोधाभास देखाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'In spite of' is followed by a noun phrase ('her tiredness') and shows contrast. Citations: chapter 13, page 225.

gaps.explanationNepali: वाक्य 'She is very good...' सकारात्मक छ र 'be' verb प्रयोग गर्दछ, त्यसैले प्रश्न ट्याग नकारात्मक ('isn't she?') हुनुपर्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The statement 'She is very good...' is positive and uses the 'be' verb, so the tag must be negative ('isn't she?'). Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो तेस्रो प्रकारको conditional वाक्य हो (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), जसले भूतकालको एक असम्भव अवस्थालाई जनाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), which refers to an unreal past condition. Citations: chapter 5, page 80.

gaps.explanationNepali: Causative verb 'get' को संरचना 'get + agent (person) + to-infinitive' हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The structure for the causative verb 'get' is 'get + agent (person) + to-infinitive'. Citations: chapter 18, page 307.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो वाक्य passive voice मा छ र simple present tense मा छ, जहाँ 'everyone' ले कार्य गर्दछ। संरचना 'is + v3' हो।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a passive voice sentence in the simple present tense, where 'everyone' is the agent. The structure is 'is + v3'. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.
